alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:14PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 613 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium to near North Cheyenne. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, brief heavy rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Tie City Campground, South Greeley, Vedauwoo, Federal, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford, North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Ranchettes, Granite Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Horse Creek, Warren Af Base and Yellow Pine Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 34. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 320 and 366. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
